medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain, fever, and hypotension after a cesarean section.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began three days post-elective cesarean section. Initially, the patient experienced an episode of rigors without fever. On the second postpartum day, diffuse abdominal pain developed, most severe in the left lower quadrant, with no further passage of flatus or stool. The temperature rose to 38.4°C and abdominal distention increased. By the early morning of the third postpartum day, rigors and fever recurred, and hypotension occurred (blood pressure 80/48 mm Hg) with a pulse of 130 beats per minute.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gestational diabetes (diet-controlled), previous pregnancy complicated by cephalopelvic disproportion requiring vacuum extraction, appendectomy.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with fiancé and child, works in an office, smokes 10 cigarettes per day, takes prenatal vitamins, allergic to penicillin.
